intro: Mitrasacme lepidocalyx, commonly known as the velvetleaf mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Mitrasacme lepidocalyx is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
